channel.title: Civilization 2
channel.description:
Civilization 2 is a game where you raise a civilization from hunter gatherers to the modern age, using taxes, scientific research, and luxuries to control the economy, diplomats and military units to fight for conquest, and wonders of the world to gain huge benifits for your civilization.
I usually head straight for Fundamentalism, Communism, or if I'm lazy, Monothiesm, and then concentrate on global conquest. I spend the first few thosuand years building lots of cities and few improvements. If I build a wonder it's usually the Lighthouse for help with the ocean conquest, Marco Polos embassy to get maps faster and establish where enemy civs are, or maybe Sun Tzus War Academy if I don't have many barracks.
Civilization 2 can be downloaded here: http://www.abandonia.com/games/99/Civilization2/Civilization2.htm (mirror: http://asmo.jakki.org/civ2.zip)
If you try playing it, please post your preffered playing style. The reason I posted this here (in GD instead of Games) is because I want to see how different people rule their civilizations. Violent dictator? Benevolent president?

item.title: Civilization 2
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

I have this game on the Original playstation, it frigging owns.

Best to head for demoracy frist - build statue of liberty (then you can alter you goverment style with no period of anarchy)
Then choose fundamentalism

Other key wonders-
Great lbirary if you playing 3 or more opponents and yu ahve the great library there is no need to do science research just ggrab money.
Leonardos worshop - upgrades all your units

item.title: Civilization 2
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Warlords is nice becuase alot is written in Python which means I can mod it easily. Made some cool shit

Civ2 is extremely easy to mod as far as basics in gameplay (and almost all graphics), and it has a powerful scenario editor, but if you want to delve really deep into modding it you have to fuck with the executable sigh.

Also, I noticed in the “Post a picture of yourself” thread that we have now both posted our pictures, and that I am infinitely better looking than you will ever be.

Read full topic

item.title: Civilization 2
item.dc:creator: @VG_Kobra VG_Kobra
item.description:
@VG_Kobra wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:20, topic:51650”][quote author=VG_Kobra link=topic=72482.msg821090#msg821090 date=1169776434]
Lol I just started playing it and I feel like I’m 10 again. Back then all I would do is sit in front of the comp and play Starcraft or Red Alert. The graphics and layout is almost the same too
[/quote]

Yeah. I love sprites myself, and was horrified when games like Runescape2 an Doom3 abandoned sprite based graphics. Doom 3 would have been much better with huge 32-angled sprites.

The gameplay in Civ2 is the polar opposite of Starcraft and Red Alert, though.[/quote]

Yeah I know, but its the layout, and the views etc. Have a strange DejaVu likeness. But they’re both based on strategy.

Now your damn game has me looking for a Starcraft torrent! Damn Nostalgia!

Read full topic

item.title: Civilization 2
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:

VG_Kobra:

Lol I just started playing it and I feel like I’m 10 again. Back then all I would do is sit in front of the comp and play Starcraft or Red Alert. The graphics and layout is almost the same too

Yeah. I love sprites myself, and was horrified when games like Runescape2 an Doom3 abandoned sprite based graphics. Doom 3 would have been much better with huge 32-angled sprites.

The gameplay in Civ2 is the polar opposite of Starcraft and Red Alert, though.
